definition[0]: to make someone leave a place or building by using force
example[0]: The demonstrators were ejected from the hall.
definition[1]: to make someone leave a job or position very quickly
example[1]: 420 workers have been ejected from their jobs with no warning.
example[2]: Two engines cut out and the plane started to eject fuel as it lost height.
definition[3]: if a pilot ejects, he or she escapes from a plane, using an ejector seat because it is going to crash
definition[4]: if you eject a disk or a tape, or if it ejects, it comes out of a machine after you have pressed a particular button
